dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michelle's eyes slowly open. She's back on the mattress, thin blanket covering her again. A tray of food sits on the floor next to the bed. The two four and shovel are gone. Howard sits on a folding chair by the door, his forearm i now wrapped with a bandage where she hit him with the woo She peers at him through the dim light. Is he sleeping? props herself up. His voice cuts through the darkness, startling her --

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: You should eat the eggs. You’1ll be dreaming of fresh food before long. Michelle looks at the tray of food, then back to Howard - detachment in his voice, intelligence in his weary eyes. combination that makes him hard to read.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: In a couple of weeks, everything's going to be from a can. Panic sets in again. Michelle grabs her cell. Holds it up

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: I called the police. They'll be here any minute. Let me go now. You'll be in a lot less trouble. Michelle shoots him a defiant look. Howard shakes his head --

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: You've got no idea what happened, do you? Michelle lowers her cell but doesn’t respond.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There was an attack last night. Some kind of bomb exploded. The city’s destroyed. Michelle looks at Howard like he’s a lunatic.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Yeah... Right.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: I was rushing back here when I came across your wrecked car. I couldn’t just leave you there.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: If you're such a good samaritan why the hell am I locked in this room?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I spent all night setting your leg and closing that wound on your head. I needed some sleep and didn't want you wandering off. (rubs his bandaged arm) Or cracking my head open with a shovel.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: You really think I'm stupid enough to fall for this?

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: I think you're smart enough to know that if I was gonna do something, I would have done it already.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: How do I know you didn't? I woke up in my underwear with no idea where I am or how I got here. That's pretty fucking disturbing.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: I’m a doctor. I had to take off your jeans to set your knee.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: I want out of here. Now.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: You can’t leave. The entire countryside is blanketed with... with some sort of poisonous chemical.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: You’re out of your mind.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: You go outside, you die. But this place has a filtration system. It should protect us from whatever is floating in the air out there.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: What's gonna protect me from you? Howard shakes his head, knows he's not going to convince of anything right now. He stands up. Michelle pulls the blanket tighter around her neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need to rest. (pointing at the tray) That's Ketamine in the small cup. It'll help with the pain. I recommend you take it... but I'll leave that up to you.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Special K? We going clubbing?

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: I'm a veterinarian. It's the strongest painkiller I have.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Thought you said you were a doctor.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: A veterinarian is a doctor. He points to her leg as he tries for a little levity.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey. Consider yourself lucky. If you were a horse, I would’ve had to put you down. Michelle’s not laughing.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Thanks, Doc. But I’m not taking a date rape drug while being held prisoner. He takes a step toward her... and there’s a tiny shift in Howard, something stirs beneath his calm exterior --

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: If I wanted to drug you, I would've crushed it up in your food or hid it in your drink. Or shot you up with it while you were already unconscious. And then I could’ve done what ever I wanted. Michelle looks sick to her stomach. Howard takes a deep breath, knows he went too far.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This is a lot to take in. For both of us. You need to eat and you need to sleep. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There will be plenty of time to talk when you're feeling better. Michelle pulls the tray onto her mattress and starts pick at the eggs. She’s not convinced of Howard's story but realizes that either way, she's fucked.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Call me if you need anything. I'll be right outside. That doesn't make her feel any better. He exits the room, leaving the door open behind him. Michelle waits a beat.. She sets the food tray back on the floor. Her hand lingers, grabs the butter knife. She tries to pull herself up, but her weight shifts to he busted knee. The pain is excruciating. Michelle grits her teeth, falls back onto the mattress, e watering. She can’t take it. She grabs the Ketamine off t tray and drinks it. She tucks the butter knife under her pillow and passes ou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Note: All of the flashbacks are grainy and high contrast it's hard to tell whether we are watching history, a memo or something altogether different.) Dozens of college students drink from plastic cups and bo to hip hop music in the basement of an off-campus house. In a back corner Michelle stands across from PATRICK (19) Despite the raging party going on around them, the expressions on their faces say that they're not having fu

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: Lauren's in my lit class. We were just studying...

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: It took you ten minutes to close your books and come downstairs?

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: I didn't hear you knock. I didn't even know you were coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted to surprise you. God, I'm such an idiot. Michelle takes a long drink from her cup.

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: Nothing happened.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: I saw the way she looked at you... the way she looked at me. She locks eyes with Patrick, daring him to lie.

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: Okay. She kissed me... But I didn't kiss her back.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: What the hell does that even mean?

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: It means you can trust me.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Trust you? Why? So you can hurt me?

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: Michelle, I love you.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Yeah? You got a fucked up way of showing it. Michelle chugs the rest of her beer, throws the empty cup Patrick and charges for the stairs. He chases after her.

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: You can't go. You need to sober up. Michelle pushes through the crowd of bodies, ignoring him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michelle wakes up. The fluorescent bulb is off but a bit light bleeds through the open door along with some noise HAMMERING and SANDING. It puts an anxious look on her fac  10. The food tray is gone. She reaches under her pillow. The butter knife is gone too. A folded t-shirt and women’s drawstring athletic shorts sit on the floor next to her c Michelle reaches over, grabs her cell and opens up her te - all six from Patrick. The last one at 2:42 a.m. -- “Sor had to end this way. I wish we could be 2gether 4ever.” Is he referring to the attack? She shakes the thought fro her head. Michelle swaps her torn, blood-crusted blouse for the t- shirt. It’s skintight but it’s clean. She then gingerly p the shorts on over her wounded knee. Michelle looks around the empty room. She calls out --

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Hey, Doc? These luxury accommodations come with a bathroom? Howard enters carrying crutches made out of some nailed together pieces of wood -- there’s material wrapped aroun the tops, sanded hand grips and duct taped feet at the bottom. They're rudimentary, but nonetheless impressive. He sets the crutches down by her mattress.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: My name’s Howard. Michelle doesn’t say anything as she pulls herself up ont the crutches. Howard reaches for her arm to steady her. She instinctively pulls away from his touch. He gets the message, turns and leads the way out of the r

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michelle enters the cramped living area. It’s windowless the same low ceilings and cinder block walls. Her eyes dart around, studying every square inch -- In the middle there’s a small table with two folding chai To her right, there's a kitchenette alongside a cupboard. Next to the cupboard, an open door leads to another room.  11. To her left, a worn couch blocks a set of stairs that disappear up into darkness. And on the far side of the room, there's a fully stocked, floor-to-ceiling wine rack that takes up the entire wall for one corner where there's a closed steel door with a deadbolt above the handle. Howard leads Michelle through the main living area into - HOWARD’S ROOM A mattress on the floor. A small chest of drawers against wall. In the back, two shower curtains come together to square off the corner. Howard pulls one of the curtains aside to reveal a toilet sink, a small mirror, and a tub. Michelle crutches by him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howard lets the curtain go but stands right outside.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Yeah, um, a little privacy, Doc. Howard heads toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: Let me know if you need any help.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: You can help by closing the door on your way out. Through the slit in the shower curtain Michelle watches Howard exit. He closes the bedroom door behind him. Michelle quickly crutches into -- HOWARD’S ROOM She hobbles to the chest of drawers and starts rooting through them. The top drawer is filled with women’s cloth The second drawer down contains men’s clothes.  12. Michelle opens the third drawer revealing a cornucopia of pharmaceuticals, including the Ketamine, antibiotics and few syringes. Michelle grabs a syringe. As she lifts it, she notices a collection of old survival magazines underneath -- A headline on the cover of one of them catches her eye -- “HOW TO MAKE A WEAPON OUT OF ANYTHING.”

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You okay in there, Michelle? Michelle startles at hearing her name. She drops the syri and shuts the drawer. Hobbles over and opens the door. Howard all but tumbles into the room, having had his ear against the door. Michelle tamps down her surprise and makes her way around back into the --

dialogues.speaker: MAIN ROOM
dialogues.text: Leaning on her crutches, she opens the cupboard. Every sq inch is taken up with canned goods and dried foods. Michelle turns to Howard.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: How do you know my name?

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: I looked in your purse, saw your driver’s license. She works her way to the back corner. She tries the steel door next to the wine rack. The deadbolt is locked. Howard watches her but doesn't say anything. Michelle takes a seat on the couch, cranes her head to lo up the stairwell but she can't see where it ends. She tries to act calm and confident --

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Okay. So where the hell are we?

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: Near Kenosha. 40 miles outside of Milwaukee. Underneath my farmhouse.  13.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: (looking at the wine rack) Where you just happen to have a fully stocked dungeon.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: I converted this cellar into a fallout shelter right after 9/11. The electricity comes from solar panels mounted on the barn roof. Water’s piped in from a well underneath the house then it goes through a reverse osmosis filter. Completely self contained. Howard leans against the table.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Started to think I went a little overboard, but figured, even if it never serves its purpose, it makes a decent wine cellar.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: How were you able to figure out what happened? The TV and radio would have stopped broadcasting the instant the bomb went off.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: The ones from Milwaukee did. But I was able to pick up a station from Chicago... until that cut out too. But it was enough info to know I needed to get here quick. Michelle loses a bit of confidence.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: You saying Chicago was hit?

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: All I know is that they’re not broadcasting anymore.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: That’s where I’m from. That’s where my mom is. I need to call her. I need to make sure she’s okay. The look on Howard's face says that she’s probably not. Michelle tears up. Howard’s not sure what to do, what to  14.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: I have a daughter in Washington, D.C. I don’t know if anything happened there. But, I mean, it’s Washington, D.C. He fights back his own emotions.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Never should have let her go.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: We need to go outside. Find a cell signal. Figure out what happened. Howard comes over, reaches out to comfort her.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. I know it’s hard, but I can’t let -- She suddenly swings her crutch --

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Get the hell away from me, you lying son of a bitch! Michelle struggles to her feet, backs against a wall. She keeps Howard at bay with her crutch.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're full of shit! There was no attack. You’re just a sick pervert trying to keep me down here. Howard looks at her, his face a blank slate. And then -- flash of anger. He pulls the couch away from the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: You want to see what’s out there? (motioning toward stairs) Go ahead. Howard keeps his distance as Michelle cautiously crutches way to the steps, struggles to climb them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michelle arrives at the top of the stairs and finds a thi lead door with a small 4x6 inch window. Howard comes halfway up the stairs behind Michelle.  15.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: Have a look. Michelle leans in and stares out the window -- MICHELLE’S POV - EVENING Late afternoon. Faint sunlight. A thin strip of the outsi world is visible along the top of the exterior stairwell Sunlight kicks off the front end of a dented pickup which barely sticks out from behind the corner of a rundown bar Outside the barn, there’s a fenced in pen occupied by -- TWO DEAD PIGS. But not just dead -- their skin is complet gone -- peeled, sliced or melted away. All that remains a two huge blobs of blood-stained muscle and fat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michelle pulls away. Terror pulses through her body.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: Believe me now? Howard climbs the stairs as Michelle tries to get her panicked breathing under control.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Mildred and Frank. They seemed fine when we got here. I looked out a few hours later. That’s what I saw.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: What happened to them?

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: I don’t know. Howard flips a switch on a kluged together piece of electronic equipment by the door. A steady CLICKING SOUND emanates from the machine as the meter fluctuates slightl

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This is a Geiger counter. A wire runs from the device to a wand. Howard threads the wand through a small hole in the door. The clicking speed and the meter moves but only a little.  16.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Definitely radioactive fallout in the air, but not enough to do that kind of damage, not that quickly.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Yeah. Looks more like the work of some twisted freak with a knife.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: (to himself) God grant me the serenity... Howard pulls the wand in. Looks up at Michelle.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There’s something else out there. Some sort of chemical, like mustard gas... or worse. Michelle subtly braces herself against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Whatever it is, we sure as hell can’t open this door. Without warning -- Michelle shoves Howard as hard as she He loses balance, tumbles down the steps, ass over elbows Michelle grabs the door handle, turns it. But it's locked

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: God damn it! Michelle frantically pulls at the door. Howard gets to his feet -- his body fills the bottom of t stairwell, blocking the light from the room. Michelle bangs on the small window.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Help! Somebody help me! Howard rubs his shoulder as he climbs the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: What the hell is wrong with you?! There's real anger in his voice.  17. Michelle smashes her crutch against the glass, against th handle, but it’s pointless. She begins sobbing, slides do the wall until her butt hits the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Please let me go. Please. I promise, I won’t tell anyone. Howard stops a few steps below her.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: (bordering on creepy) There’s no one to tell. Michelle looks up at Howard, horrified.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: How long are you going to keep me here?

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: You're not a prisoner.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: (through her sobs) Then open the fucking door. Howard leans in, breathing right in her ear. Michelle cowers as his hand reaches toward her... then pa her. He switches off the Geiger counter.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: You're not thinking straight. Probably have a concussion. Then there’s the shock of all this info. Howard stands back up, towering over her.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You open that door and whatever’s out there comes in here. Is that what you want? To end up looking like my hogs? Michelle can’t tell if it’s a warning or a threat. They stare at each other for a long moment. She finally shakes her head... surrenders. Howard turns, lumbers back down the stairs. And as he goe the sun sets outside, leaving Michelle in near darkness.  18.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking in the mirror, Michelle peels the blood-crusted g off her forehead. The cut is still gruesome, but the blee has stopped. She tapes on a clean piece of gauze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howard sits at the table fiddling with a small radio but nothing's being broadcast. Michelle crutches into the room. Howard looks over.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: (spinning the dial) See?

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: I see a broken radio. Howard shakes his head as Michelle crutches by him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michelle sleeps restlessly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michelle pushes through partying students on the porch as storms out of the house toward her car. Patrick continues after her.

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: Come on, Michelle. I made a mistake. Give me another chance.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: (slurring slightly) Same thing my dad used to say. And my mom was stupid enough to believe it. Until he left her for good.

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: This is about you and me. Not them. Michelle opens her car door.  19.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: You're right. It's about you and me. And Lauren. And that's one too many. She gets in the car and slams the door. Patrick grabs the handle but it's already locked.

dialogues.speaker: PATRICK
dialogues.text: Get out of the car. You're not alright to drive. Seriously. Michelle peels away from the curb -- Two students jump out of the way. She squeals around a corner and disappears into the night

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michelle wakes with a start. She looks over to -- HOWARD standing silently in the doorway. He turns and wal away without a word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michelle inspects her damaged knee. Then she glances at Howard’s dresser drawers. She crutches toward them, keepi nervous eye on the door to the main room.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You alright in there? She stops.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Yeah. I’m fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howard and Michelle sit at the table, eating in silence. looks at her, but she keeps her eyes on her plate.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: (trying for small talk) What were you doing in Milwaukee? Eyes down, Michelle pushes her food around with her fork.  20.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: (almost robotic) Visiting a friend. (a beat) But he’s probably dead, right? So what’s the point in talking about it? So much for small talk. Howard bites his tongue as he pus away from the table. FADE TO BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few days have passed. Michelle looks at herself in the mirror. She peels the gauze from her head. The wound is healed enough that she doesn’t replace the gauze. She runs water but sneaks from the bathroom -- using the noise to mask her movement. She hobbles into -- HOWARD’S ROOM She crosses the room without her crutches, limping but mo reasonably well. Michelle opens a drawer and takes the magazine with the “ TO MAKE A WEAPON OUT OF ANYTHING” cover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michelle maneuvers through the main room -- past Howard. leans heavily on the crutches making it appear that she’s completely dependent on them to get around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Using the sharp edge of a soup can lid, Michelle whittles away at the end of one of her crutches, slowly shaping it into a point. She hears Howard moving outside and quickly rewraps the end with tape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michelle lies on her mattress as Howard unwraps the banda on her knee. Michelle winces as the last layer sticks to pus-covered wound. Howard tugs it off.  21.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Ow! Damn it. That hurt. They both stare at the wound. It’s gruesome.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I need to go to a hospital. I need a real doctor. Howard ignores the dig.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: Where are you hiding them?

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: The antibiotics. Michelle doesn’t answer.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Think you'll still be able to refuse medicine when this turns into gangrene... and I have to saw your leg off? Michelle looks from the wound to Howard. He’s serious. She reaches into a small slit on the side of her mattress digs out a dozen pills. She sets them on the bed. Howard separates them into two piles.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (pointing at one pile) You’re welcome to suffer through the pain all you want... (points at the other pile) But you will take the antibiotics. Michelle picks up one pill from each pile. Pops them both into her mouth and swallows.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Happy? Howard rewraps Michelle’s knee with a clean bandage then up and heads for the door.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: I’m stuck down here too, you know.  22. He pulls the door shut on his way out. Michelle reaches over and grabs her crutch. She unravels duct tape and goes back to work, sharpening it into a poi The painkiller kicks in. She groggily tucks the lid back under the mattress then lies down and drifts to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michelle speeds on a winding country road. A truck pulls behind her. Its LIGHTS GLARE in her rearview mirror. It s to get closer and closer. Michelle swerves across the road drunkenly. The truck HON She guns the engine, accelerates. The truck keeps pace, tailgating her yet again. She glances at her rearview. The glare blinds her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michelle jolts awake. The bedroom door is open, but she’s alone. She reaches fo her crutches, notices that the tape at the foot of one of them is unraveled, the carved point clearly visible. She grabs it and tapes it up. But she has no idea if Howa was in the room to see it or not. She lies back on the bed for a moment, listens. Nothing b the WHOOSH of air coming in through the vent above her. Michelle stares up at the vent -- an idea comes to her. S grabs her crutches and limps out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michelle peeks into Howard’s room. He snores on his mattr She quietly closes his door then stares up at the ventila system above the kitchenette where two air ducts branch o from the main register and pipe into the bedrooms.  23.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michelle strips the cover from her pillow. She uses the s point on her crutch to rip one end open and begins pullin out the polyester stuffing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michelle climbs onto a folding chair beneath the main ven She pulls off the cover and shoves the stuffing into the ventilation system. When she has it all in, she takes a crutch and pushes it far into the duct as possible. She climbs off the chair then reaches up and BANGS on the vent with her crutch until Howard's snoring stops. She hears him moving and quickly limps back into her room

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michelle catches a glimpse of Howard through the open doo She waits a beat then hobbles out of the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howard is on a chair underneath the main duct. His ear an his hand are pressed up against the vent. Howard turns to Michelle -- deadly serious look on his fa

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: The ventilation system is failing. Michelle’s face gives nothing away.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: What are you gonna do?

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: Don’t know. If it’s the solar panels we’re screwed because I can’t go outside to repair them. He turns valves on the ducts that lead into the bedrooms.  24.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m shutting down the bedroom flow. We'll have to limit ourselves to this room. Keep the system from having to work so hard. He gets down from the chair.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: What about the bathroom?

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: I‘ll keep a bucket in here. Short of that, you'll have to be quick. Howard seems to be staring at the tape on the bottom of Michelle’s crutches as he speaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michelle sets two plates on the table, unidentifiable blo of canned meat and pale vegetables on both.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Two years worth of food down here and not a single piece of chocolate. Howard stands on a folding chair, his face against the ve

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: Surviving is about the essentials. Michelle drops into a chair, exhausted. She stares at the wall of wine, looks around the rest of the sparse room.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Yeah, there’s no way a bag of chocolates would've fit in here.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: Tell you what. Next time I’m planning for the apocalypse, I'1l make sure to buy candy bars. Right now we have more pressing problems. He gets down from the chair and joins Michelle at the tab They both struggle to catch their breath.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (somber ) We're not getting enough oxygen. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I might have to go outside and see if I can fix it.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Thought it was poisonous outside.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: It is. But we’re facing carbon dioxide poisoning down here. Something has to be done. Howard picks up a fork and starts eating. Michelle just stares at her plate. Is she having second thoughts?

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: If this crap is our last meal, we need something better than water to wash it down. She crutches over to the wine rack and grabs a random bot

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: You’re not old enough for that.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Feel free to call the cops. She sets the bottle on the table, hobbles over and digs through the utensil drawer.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: You were drinking the night you crashed. I could smell it on you.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: (laughs) Then drunk driving saved my life. Otherwise I’d be a skinless corpse, right? (frustrated) Where’s the corkscrew?

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: I’ve never opened a bottle down here. It’s just storage. Guess we'll have to make do with water. Michelle pulls off her shoe. She grabs the bottle and put the base of it in the bottom of the shoe then starts gent banging it against the nearby door frame.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What are you doing?  26.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Most parents won't notice if a bottle of wine disappears, but they will notice a missing corkscrew. Michelle is breathing heavily from the lack of oxygen, bu little by little the wine forces the cork from the bottle When it’s halfway up, she twists it the rest of the way o She takes a moment to catch her breath, then fills her gl She goes to fill Howard’s glass. He holds his hand over i

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: I don’t drink. Michelle looks over at the wall of wine.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: That just decorative? Howard looks down at his dinner plate.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: I used to. I don’t anymore. Michelle raises her glass.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: More for me then. Cheers. She takes a big swig.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michelle’s food is still uneaten but the wine bottle is h empty. The lack of oxygen mixed with the booze has her ti She refills her glass.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: You’ve had enough. Michelle picks up her glass and takes a gulp. She looks a the full wine rack.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Why keep all those bottles if you don’t drink?

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: It’s a long story.  27.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: (sarcastic) Yeah, maybe you can tell me some day when we have more time. Howard shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: Maybe I‘11 tell you some day when you’re ready to listen. Michelle stares at the unappetizing food on the plate in front of her.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: I can’t look at this shit anymore. Michelle, still tipsy, grabs her plate and limps over to sink WITHOUT HER CRUTCHES. Howard watches her intently as she makes her way back to table and sits down next to her forgotten crutches.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: (suspiciously) Your knee’s getting a lot better. Michelle takes another drink of wine, plays it cool.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Guess the alcohol numbs the pain. Howard nods dubiously. All of a sudden, he gets up from h chair and walks to the back of the room. He digs a small ring out of his pocket and opens up the locked closet doo Howard pulls out the shovel before closing the door and locking it.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: Wondering how I could be so naive. Howard walks underneath the main duct, tapping it with th shovel handle as he goes. TAP -- a hollow echo. TAP -- another hollow echo. TAP -- hollow sound. Howard glances at Michelle. She fights to keep a disinterested look on her face.  28. He walks a few more feet. Reaches up, TAPS again -- and t part of the duct answers with a muted THUMP. Howard climbs onto a chair. He pushes the shovel deep int the vent and starts fishing around. Michelle surreptitiously unwraps the tape from the bottom her crutch under the table as she keeps her eyes on Howar Howard pulls the shovel out, bringing a big chunk of polyester pillow stuffing with it. Air immediately starts flowing into the room again. Howard looks at Michelle. He’s furious.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I pulled you from a crushed car. Kept you safe from whatever’s in the air out there. I gave you antibiotics from my limited supply. He climbs off the chair, shakes the edge of the shovel at as he speaks. He doesn’t seem to notice her shaky hands working underneath the table.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You were a stranger. I owed you nothing. But I helped you anyhow. And instead of thanking me, you try to kill us both. Howard takes a step toward Michelle. She jumps up from th table and thrusts her spike-tipped crutch at Howard. He knocks it aside with the shovel. She pulls it back, ready to strike again.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Is that your plan? Lock me up and keep telling me how thankful I should be until I throw myself at you? Well, it’s never gonna happen. (raises the spear higher) I won’t let you hurt me.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: That’s the beauty of it. I don’t have to. He throws the shovel down.  29.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m gonna let you hurt yourself. He reaches into his pocket and pulls out his key ring. Se it on the table.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’s the small brass one. Michelle hesitates for a long moment, not sure if she believes him, not sure if this is some kind of a test.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're free to go. Howard drags the couch away from the stairwell. Keeping the crutch pointed in front of her, Michelle step forward, grabs the keys off the table. She limps toward the exit, crutch at the ready.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There's just one thing... Howard’s voice wavers between menace and regret.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Once you leave, you can't come back. You'll be covered with whatever it is that melted the skin off my hogs. Go ahead and kill yourself if you like. But I’m not going to let you kill me too. Your choice. Michelle makes her way into the --

dialogues.speaker: STAIRWELL
dialogues.text: She slowly climbs the stairs. Daylight filters in through tiny window above. She gets to the top, fumbles with the key ring -- She sticks the small brass key in the lock -- She pauses, looks back down the stairs. Howard’s nowhere be seen. But he calls out --  30.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Leave the keys in the door. And be quick to close it. Michelle pauses... Decision time. She hesitates -- And then the daylight from the window suddenly goes DARK. Michelle spins around -- a man in a hazmat hood presses against the window -- looking right at her. He BANGS frantically.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: (muffled) Open the door! Open the god damn door! Michelle SCREAMS in terror. Howard rushes to the bottom of the stairs, sees the figur the other side of the window --

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: Do not open that door! Michelle panics, spins the key, unlocking the door. Before Howard can get up to her, the man pulls open the d and enters, pushing into Michelle -- TOUCHING HER -- The man blocks Michelle from getting out. He spins back, shuts and locks the door. Then strips off his hazmat hood

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: (whispering) Shh! We don’t want them to find us. This is NATE (20s), his matted hair and dirty face only enhance his rugged good looks.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: (whispering) Get back! Get away from me! Howard disappears down the stairwell. Michelle hesitates. Maybe it’s the booze or the lack of oxygen -- or maybe it something in Nate’s voice that convinces her. But Michell backs down the stairs, away from the door.  31. Nate looks out the window one more time before he heads d into the --

dialogues.speaker: MAIN ROOM
dialogues.text: Howard stands on a chair under the vent, turning the valv on the ducts that lead to the bedrooms.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: We need to get that suit cleaned off. Right now. Nate hurries past Michelle into Howard’s room -- he clear knows his way around.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: What the hell is going on?

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: (a concerned look) That’s Nate.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: You know him? Howard nods, but not happily. He gets down from the chair heads for his bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nate strips off the suit. Underneath he’s only wearing a of boxers and few tattoos. He throws the suit in the tub. Howard comes in and starts running the water over it. Nate looks back, sees Michelle in the bedroom doorway. He hurries into -- HOWARD’S ROOM -- in just his boxers. Michelle can’t help but notice Nat in great shape.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: You touched the suit. You need to get washed off right away. He reaches for her. She doesn’t resist. He leads her back the --  32.

dialogues.speaker: BATHROOM
dialogues.text: Howard scrubs the suit which is completely submerged. Nat holds a towel under the faucet -- but the water flow has reduced to a drip. Nate begins to put the towel in the tu

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: No! Water might be contaminated. Howard closes the faucet.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Try the sink. Nate spins the sink faucet. It sputters and a weak stream water flows out. Nate wets the towel as he turns to Michelle.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Those clothes have to go. Throw ‘em in the tub with the suit. Then wash yourself down.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: If you want to keep your skin, you need to lose your clothes. Now! Michelle takes the towel, pauses, looks at Nate then Howa who’s paying no attention as he cleans the hazmat suit. Nate sighs, turns away from her.

dialogues.speaker: NATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No time to be modest. Michelle strips down to her underwear. Nate keeps his back to her, but turns enough to sneak a p in the mirror as Michelle washes herself down with the to

dialogues.speaker: ON HOWARD
dialogues.text: He turns the hazmat suit inside out to scrub the rest. And he sees -- written on the inside in permanent marker: PROPERTY OF JOHN BENNETT, PIKEVILLE FIRE DEPT.  33. Howard stares at the name, his face tightening up. He gla at Nate, who still has his back turned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nate, now in a pair of Howard’s jeans and a t-shirt, sits the table with Howard. They speak in tense whispers.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: Got some nerve showing up here now.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: You said I was always welcome.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: A lot’s changed since then. And you know it. Michelle walks in, dressed in a different set of clothes. Nate eyes her as she heads for the couch.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: (to Howard) A little greedy wanting to keep this all for yourself. She sits on the couch and looks at the men distrustfully.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: (to Howard, re: Nate) He was out there. He seems fine.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: Because of the hazmat suit. (stares at Nate) Lucky you happened to have that.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: (to Howard) This all part of the plan? You couldn’t convince me so you called for backup.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: What’s her problem?

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: Not sure where to start.  34.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: You're both full of shit and now you’re sitting there trying to get your lies straight.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: You seriously think I’ve been standing at the top of the stairs in a hazmat suit for a week -- just waiting for you to open the door? When he puts it that way, it does sound like a stretch.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: I don’t know what to think anymore.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Lucky you. This is one of those cases where ignorance is bliss.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: (under his breath) Then she should be ecstatic. Nate gets up from the table, walks over to Michelle. He offers his hand along with his most charming look.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: I’m Nate. I built this place --

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: You helped. Nate ignores him -- keeps his focus on Michelle.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: What’s your name?

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Michelle. He reaches out and she gives him a half-hearted shake. Na takes a seat on the couch next to her still holding her h

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: I wasn’t expecting to find anyone but Howard here. (flashes a magnetic smile) Guess my luck finally took a turn. Nate squeezes Michelle’s hand. She pulls it away guardedl  35.

dialogues.speaker: NATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Nice to meet you, Michelle. Out of the corner of her eye, Michelle glimpses Howard furrowing his eyebrows at the sight of Nate next to her. Michelle turns, offers Nate a forced smile.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Nice to meet you too, Nate.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: (interrupting the moment) So how is it out there?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Something’s still in the air. Not as bad as it was but... (a beat) On the way here, I came across a guy that looked like he’d been dropped in a deep-fryer. That'd been me if I didn’t have a suit.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Did everyone but me know the world was about to end? Howard stands, moves closer to them.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: So what happened? Who’s behind it?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Well, there was a lot of talk... But not a lot of answers. Nate leans forward on the couch. Howard and Michelle star with anticipation. This guy knows how to tell a story.

dialogues.speaker: NATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’s all just rumors... But word is, Iran got hold of some Russian stockpiles -- nuclear, chemical, the works. Hired some fanatical whack jobs to hand deliver the bombs. Then they exploded the chemical stuff everywhere else.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Russians probably made it easy for them.  36.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: Hold on a second. I rescue you. Keep you safe. And you refuse to believe a word I say. But this guy shows up and tells us the obvious and you buy in?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: I have an honest face.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: I didn't say I believed him. It’s just his story makes sense. Michelle startles as the ventilation system GROANS... the starts emitting a cyclical CLUNKING sound.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: Christ. Your little stunt must've damaged the system.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Can you fix it?

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: I'd have to go out for that.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: I‘ll do it.

dialogues.speaker: NATE HOWARD
dialogues.text: No! Not a chance in hell. Michelle’s taken aback by their adamant response.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: You’ve done enough damage already.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: And it’s not safe. There are people out there. Not a lot, but a few. Scavengers. They’re desperate.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Shouldn't we try to help them?

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: The water pump’s stressed. The ventilation system’s struggling. There are too many of us down here already.  37. INT. HOWARD’S ROOM Howard puts on the hazmat suit. He doesn’t pull down the yet. He walks out into the --

dialogues.speaker: MAIN ROOM
dialogues.text: Michelle and Nate are on the couch -- and too close to ea other. Howard looks them over, grits his teeth.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: If I can’t get it fixed, then I’m not sure we can support three people down here.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: What are we gonna do, draw straws?

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: It’s my cellar. I decide.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Get on out there. (laughs) You could use some fresh air. Howard exhales irritably, closes the mask without respond

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark and overcast. The modest farm house sits in the middle of nowhere. Fall fields in front, thick woods in back. The dead pigs rot in their pen. The cellar door opens. Howard steps out. He looks back as door slams shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michelle stands by the table. Nate comes down the stairs takes a seat on the couch.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: You really think he’d make you leave?  38.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: (shrugs) He didn’t say it’d be me. He just said he gets to decide. Michelle walks over and sits down next to Nate.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: You'd let him kick me out?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Howard’s shit when it comes to people, but he’s good with machines. He’ll fix it. Not exactly the answer Michelle was looking for.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Something happen between you two?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: He hired me to help him convert this place to what it is now. About halfway through, he started changing everything. But didn’t want to pay. So I walked. Guess he’s still pissed off about it.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: And you think... you think he’s alright?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Did something happen between you two?

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: No. It’s just, he seems off.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Everyone thought he was nuts when he built this place. But then again, I guess he was right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howard climbs to the top of a ladder. As he steps onto th roof, something catches his leg. He looks back -- it’s a bent nail, tugging at the hazmat suit, nearly causing it to rip.  39. Howard carefully takes a step back and releases himself f the nail. He then moves across the roof in the wan light. His BREAT FOGS the plastic mask. He stops at the solar panels. A large tree branch has fal across the panels. Two of the four are cracked. Howard sh the branch to the side. The branch rolls off the edge of the barn and lands with echoing WHACK! Howard freezes, looks around... Nothing but emptiness and silence. And then -- THWOCKA-THWOCKA-THWOCKA-THWOCKA. Howard spins around and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the horizon, something in the air, way out in the dist -- maybe a helicopter? Howard wipes the fog from his face mask... His hand moves away but whatever it was has slipped behin hill before Howard can make heads or tails of it.

dialogues.speaker: WIDE
dialogues.text: Howard stares at the horizon but it’s empty. He turns bac the roof, looks over the rest of the solar panels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howard heads for the cellar door. He stops, turns and mak for the front door of the farm house instead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howard opens the closet door in his bedroom. He pulls out small safe and sets it on his bed. He unlocks it -- The safe door opens revealing a revolver and a box of amm  40.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howard comes down the stairs into the --

dialogues.speaker: KITCHEN
dialogues.text: Howard grabs a plastic trash bag from under the sink. He stuffs the gun and ammo into it, then pulls open a cabine

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howard enters the cellar, locking the door behind him. He hurries down the stairs, trash bag in hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howard gives Nate and Michelle a thumbs up as he rushes p them toward his room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howard steps into the bathroom, takes the gun out of the trash bag and quickly wraps it in a towel. He throws the in the tub. Then he begins stripping out of the hazmat su Michelle pulls aside the shower curtain.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: See anything out there? Howard pauses, considers his answer.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: Nope... Nothing. Howard turns on the water -- a weak stream drips. Nate steps up behind Michelle.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: What’s in the bag? Howard pulls the bag from the tub, reaches inside and pul out a sealed bag of Hershey’s miniature chocolates. He wi it with a wet towel, then throws it to Michelle with a sm

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: Dessert.  4l.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howard and Michelle sit at the table as Nate works at the kitchenette behind them. Michelle fills two glasses to the brim with wine. Howard watches, a look of disappointment on his face.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: (with flair) The house special for the lady. Nate sets a plate down in front of Michelle. It’s the sam canned food but he’s arranged things to look almost appetizing. Michelle smiles. Howard rolls his eyes, turns a suspicious eye to Nate.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: Where did you get that hazmat suit? Howard keeps his eyes on Nate who pauses before he answer

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: I’m a volunteer firefighter. When the attack happened, I went straight to the firehouse. We all suited up waiting for orders. But nothing came. Land lines, cell phones, radios -- everything was dead. Didn’t take long before most of the guys went home to check on their families. When none of them came back, I figured I’d take my chances and come here.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: I didn’t know you were volunteering at the fire department.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Just started a few months back. (pointed) If you came into town more often, you'd know that.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: Charlie still running the show down there?  42.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Charlie? Yeah. He sure is. Howard locks eyes with Nate.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: My old pal John Bennett volunteers too. You must know John. A moment of tension -- Nate’s eyes say be careful.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Nope. Must not have the same shift. Howard and Nate stare each other down. Nate turns to Michelle, takes a sip of his wine. Swishes in his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: NATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh that’s nice. A little oaky with hints of raspberry. Mmmm. Smooth finish. Howard looks up from his plate.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: Don’t know what you’re talking about, do you? Nate holds his glass out to Howard.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Wanna show me how it’s done? Howard ignores the question -- he just stares at Nate.

dialogues.speaker: NATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (turns to Michelle) What do you taste, Michelle? Michelle takes a sip. Swishes it the same way Nate did.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: I do taste the raspberry.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: (smiles at Howard) How can you argue with that? Howard struggles to cover up his irritation.  43.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Empty dinner plates and crumpled candy wrappers. Nate was down the last of the wine. Howard pushes his dish and silverware toward Nate.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: I bought dinner. How about you do the washing up. Nate pushes the plate back toward Howard.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: I’m still thirsty. Michelle, why don’t you grab another bottle. (still looking at Howard) It’s not like we have to drive anywhere. Michelle gets up -- drunkenly wobbles to the wine rack.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: (quietly to Nate) Remember, this is my cellar and that’s my wine. You’re just a guest.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: (leans in close) Then start treating me like a guest. Howard stands up, walks into his room and closes the door Michelle limps back over with a new bottle of wine.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: What was that all about?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Howard used to have a drinking problem.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: I know. He told me.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: He also tell you about his wife? Michelle shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: NATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I guess he wouldn’t. About three years ago she was killed. He wasn’t charged, but most folks around here figured it fairly suspicious. Michelle drops into her seat.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Oh my god. That’s awful. Then who has his daughter?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: What daughter?

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: He told me that he has a daughter in Washington, D.C.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Howard never had any kids. Michelle sets the wine bottle on the table, suddenly her thoughts a jumble.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Why would he lie about that? Nate takes the bottle, starts opening it.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: (ominous ) I don’t know. Maybe to gain your trust. But we ought to be watching out for each other. Pressure seems to be getting to him down here. Nate fills Michelle's empty glass with more wine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nate sits on the couch, very close to Michelle. She holds nearly empty glass of wine in her lap. Her head bobs. Nat takes the glass off her lap and sets it on the floor. He turns and leans in for a kiss.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Nooo... mmmmmm. Michelle pushes him away clumsily.  45. Howard opens his door, comes into the room. Nate breaks off from his attempted make-out session. Howard grabs some crackers out of the cupboard. He sits a the table and slowly goes about opening them, staring dag at Nate the entire time. Nate stares right back as Michelle falls sideways on the couch and passes out. Nate looks at her, then back at How Nate gets up off the couch.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Guess I’1l take the bed tonight. Nate goes into the small bedroom and slams the door. Howard eats his crackers while staring at Michelle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howard SAWS and HAMMERS on a piece of wood. The bedroom door opens. Nate comes out holding his head, looking like complete shit. Howard whacks at a nail, notices Nate wincing with each strike.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: What the hell time is it? Howard looks around the windowless cellar.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: Does it matter?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Where’s Michelle?

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: She’s in the bathroom. Throwing up. You must be proud of yourself. Nate settles into a chair as Howard goes back to his hammering -- a big smile on his face each time Nate wince Michelle stumbles in, holding her head with both hands. S collapses to the couch. Her face is the same color as the cinder block walls.  46.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: I think that stuff is seeping in here. Feels like my skin is peeling off.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: So you finally believe me. Howard pounds in another nail.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Can you stop hammering for a minute! Howard stops hammering. He looks over to Nate.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: Almost done.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: With what?

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: The frame on one of the solar panels was broken. This should hold it for a while at least.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: When’re you gonna take it out?

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: I’m not. You are.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Why me?

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: Because it’s time you start earning your keep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nate climbs the stares in the hazmat suit, holding the wo corner. Howard waits until he hears the door close then h walks up the --

dialogues.speaker: STAIRWELL
dialogues.text: And locks the door behind Nate.  47.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howard sits down next to Michelle on the couch.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: Nate’s a liar.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: The hazmat suit. It had someone else’s name in it.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: So he grabbed the wrong suit in the panic.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: He also said Charlie Winston was still fire chief. But Charlie retired years ago. I was at the party.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: What’s your point?

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: If he doesn’t work at the fire department, how'd he get the suit? And what happened to the guy who’s name is on it?

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Why don’t you just ask him?

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: Look, Nate’s been in and out of trouble for as long as I’ve known him. Spent some time in prison -- mostly small stuff. But he’s got a violent streak in him. You should be careful. Just then -- pounding from the top of the stairwell. Howard doesn’t move.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Let him in.  48.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: Did you hear what I just told you? He can’t be trusted.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Let. Him. In. Howard gets up, heads for the stairwell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howard and Nate finish their meal. Michelle stands at the sink, watching water drip from the open faucet into her e glass.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: It’s getting worse.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: We're using too much water. Nate takes his dish over to Michelle. Tosses it in the si

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Leave ‘em. Howard’ll figure it out. He playfully slaps her ass. She jumps, swats at him --

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: (flirting) Can you please not do that?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: It’s really hard not to. Nate winks. Michelle smiles.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: God... Howard’s stomach turns as he watches them. He pushes back chair. It SCRAPES loudly, grabbing Nate and Michelle's attention.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: Fuck it. He crosses to the wine rack, selects a bottle. He turns b and hands it to Michelle.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Go on, open it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michelle goes through the process. Howard pulls out TWO wine glasses, sets them on the table Michelle pulls the cork out and puts the bottle down. How pours two small portions into the glasses.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: 1986 Montrachet. Best bottle in the cellar. You don’t want to know what it’s worth. But the idea of it sitting down here, untouched, as the world ends -- or worse yet, having you two heathens drink it on your own, without half a clue what’s on your lips -- well, that thought is more than I can bear. Howard sets one glass in front of Michelle, picks up the other himself. He swirls the wine, puts his nose to the g and inhales deeply. He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Cheers. Michelle doesn’t touch her glass. Howard clinks it anyway then takes a mouthful of the wine.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That’s the stuff! Howard picks the bottle up, fills his glass to the rim. A chugs the entire glass as Nate and Michelle watch in sile

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Don’t you want to savor it? Howard ignores him.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: (to Michelle) Try it. She doesn’t move.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What’s wrong with you? That’s a few hundred dollars worth of wine in your glass. It’s oaky. With a hint of raspberries. Michelle watches as Howard pours himself another full gla  50.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Maybe you should slow down. Howard pounds the wine.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: (glares at Michelle) What’s the problem, princess? You couldn’t get enough last night.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Back off.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: I wasn't talking to you. (back to Michelle) Were you visiting your boyfriend in Milwaukee? Michelle doesn’t answer.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Pretty girl like you. You've probably had plenty of boyfriends. Those poor saps. They didn’t have a clue what they were getting into.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: (growling) I said, leave her alone. Howard’s gaze shifts to Nate. He lifts his glass, but doe drink.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: You know what this is? This thing I’ve done for both of you? It’s called charity. And when someone provides you with charity, the polite thing to do is thank them.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: You wouldn’t have this place if it weren’t for me.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: I could've hired any old vagrant to do a half-assed job. (a beat) Hindsight being what it is, I wish I had. Nate picks up the wine bottle but keeps his eyes on Howar  51.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: You spent all your money on this cellar. And for what? Nate takes a big swig straight from the bottle. He swishe in his mouth, leans over, and spits it on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: NATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: To protect a bunch of shitty wine. Howard’s expression turns dark and unhinged... He jumps up -- flings his wine glass at Nate. It CRASHES the table. Glass and wine splatter into Nate’s face. Howard charges --

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: You fucking ingrate! Nate wipes the wine from his eyes as Howard SLAMS into hi They collide into the wall. Nate takes the brunt of the h in his back -- the oxygen rushes out of his lungs.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Stop it! Howard steps back, throws a haymaker. Nate ducks the punch and swings a fist into Howard’s gut. Howard GROANS in drunken pain. And just like that, the fi has turned. Howard has lost the initiative. Older, drunke and weaker -- he’s in trouble. Nate comes up with a crushing upper cut -- Howard stumbles backwards -- stunned. Nate stalks forward jabs Howard, follows with a right hook -- SMACK! Full impact. Howard's head snaps back, his body careens into the wine rack and -- Dozens of bottles SHATTER. Wine EXPLODES in all direction Glass rips through Howard’s skin as he tumbles to the gro Nate kicks Howard in the ribs. Hard.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That’s enough! Michelle grabs Nate around the stomach, pulls him away.  52. Howard groggily looks up from the ground, encircled by br glass and Cabernet.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: You fuckin’ come at me again, and I won’t stop. Hear me? Nate stomps into Michelle’s bedroom leaving Howard and Michelle to stare at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howard looks at himself in the mirror, picks shards of gl from his back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michelle sweeps up the mess. She looks shaken. Whatever t hell is going on, it’s getting worse and she’s starting t lose her composure. INT. HOWARD’S ROOM Howard is now bandaged up. He listens to Michelle SWEEPIN GLASS. Then climbs into his bed, each cut and bruise screaming at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michelle lies down on the couch with a blanket. Her spike tipped crutch lies on the floor in front of her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A GLASS held under the faucet, but no water comes out. Michelle stands at the sink, a concerned look on her face she stares at her empty glass. Howard walks out of his room. His REVOLVER is holstered o his hip. Michelle eyes the gun.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: It’s not working at all.  53. Howard comes over to have a look as Nate enters from Michelle’s room.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: (conciliatory) Listen, Howard, I gotta say... But his words fade away as he sees the gun.

dialogues.speaker: NATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What the hell is that for?

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: This cellar is mine. I’m in charge down here. You either get in line or you get the hell out. Nate releases a blustery chuckle. Howard reaches down, touches the butt of the gun.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You want to try me?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Okay, Howard. Whatever you say. Howard nods then turns his attention to the faucet.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: (under his breath) Too damn many of us down here. Michelle eyes both men, an uneasy look on her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howard removes a throw rug from the floor. Underneath, there’s a trap door. He pulls it open, revealing a narrow crawl space. Howard nods to Nate, hands him a flashlight

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: You first. Nate grimaces, but climbs down into the crawl space. Howa turns to Michelle.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I want you up by the door. If you see any water running through the yard, you come let me know.  54. Michelle nods as Howard drops down into the crawl space. climbs over the couch and into the --

dialogues.speaker: STAIRWELL
dialogues.text: At the top of the stairs, Michelle looks out the window - MICHELLE’S POV The yard. The dead pigs. The barn. And the front end of t pickup. This time it’s not obscured by reflecting sunligh

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MICHELLE -- staring at the yellow paint and large dent on old truck. Suddenly her blood runs cold as her memory kicks in --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michelle is blinded by the headlight glare in her rearvie She nearly veers off the road, wrenches the steering whee the last possible moment. The truck behind her HONKS again and pulls alongside her. Michelle looks over at the truck -- DENTED, YELLOW, OLD. Michelle's eyes flit back to the road, but there's a turn ahead and it's too close. The truck swerves -- is it trying to run her off the road is it just trying to pass her? Michelle overcompensates as she turns away from the truck her car weaves toward the edge of the road -- She slams on the breaks, twists the wheel -- The car SQUEALS across the pavement -- Michelle knows she won't make it. Her eyes open wide in p terror...  55.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michelle stares at the old truck -- the same one as in th flashback. She hyperventilates, struggles to regain contr of her breathing. She tries the door handle. Locked. A long beat of shallow breaths and then she turns and heads down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howard and Nate climb out of the crawl space. Nate has a small pump in his hands. Michelle stands by the men -- a troubled look on her face

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: You alright?

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Yeah. Fine. (changing the subject) What’s with the engine?

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: It’s a pump. And it’s busted.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: I can fix it.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: Let’s hope you're right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nate works on the pump. Michelle puts together another me Howard walks in from his room. He doesn’t say a word, jus pulls a bottle of wine off the wall and hands it to Miche She opens it. Nate fidgets with the pump, doesn’t look up Howard pulls out a single wine glass, sets it on the tabl Michelle pulls out the cork. It drops to the floor. As Howard reaches down for it, Michelle slips liquid Keta into his glass. Howard comes up with the cork, sets it on the table.  56. Michelle pours him a full glass of wine and forces a smil Howard nods, takes a sip.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: A little off. Might be corked. He spins the wine, sniffs it. Michelle watches nervously.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But I guess we can’t let it go to waste. Especially, now that our reserves have been... depleted. Howard takes a big drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howard is slumped on the couch, unconscious. Nate and Michelle stand over him.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: It was his truck. He ran me off the road that night. (shivers) He planned to bring me here. Guess he figured he’d at least have a plaything for the end of the world.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: He’s never been the most stable guy. And now that he’s drinking again... Nate pulls the gun from Howard’s holster.

dialogues.speaker: NATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Best that we hold onto this for safe keeping.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: He’s gonna freak when he wakes up.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Let him. Not much he can do if I'm holding the gun.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: What about me?  57.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: I’ll protect you... (nods at the stairs) Or we could just take care of it for good.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: You want to throw him out? He shrugs. Michelle shifts warily.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: He’s been talking about doing the same to us. Michelle works this over in her mind, slowly shakes her h

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: I can’t do it.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Fine. Without the gun, he can’t hurt us. Nate looks deeply into her eyes. Michelle produces a cautious smile. Nate leans in for a k And it’s decision time. Michelle balks, turns away.

dialogues.speaker: NATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What’s wrong?

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: You’1l take care of me, right?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: We'll take care of each other. Michelle reads between the lines. She leans in, kisses Na

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nate and Michelle naked on the bed, having the kind of wi passionate sex that only happens with the world coming to end. Michelle MOANS in ecstasy.  58.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howard on the couch. His eyes flicker open. He rubs his f Michelle’s MOANS echo from the other room. Howard’s brain slowly returns to consciousness as Michell works her way toward an orgasm. Howard reaches down to his waist. His gun is missing. The look on Howard’s face is chilling as he begins to pie together what’s happened. With one final SQUEAL of ecstasy, Michelle’s noise dies d And then Howard hears someone coming his way. He closes h eyes, feigns like he’s still passed out. Michelle enters and heads for the bathroom -- wearing onl her PANTIES. Howard’s eyes open to slits. He covertly watches her pass INT. HOWARD’S ROOM - LATER Howard sits on his mattress, propped up on his pillow aga the back wall. He drinks from an open wine bottle. Nate comes into the bedroom, the revolver tucked into his waistband in clear view.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: Give me back my gun. Nate passes by him and walks into the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: NATE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Not gonna happen. Howard takes another slug of wine as he’s forced to liste Nate PEE in the toilet. Nate steps out of the bathroom, heads for the door.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: Guess you never plan on sleeping again. Nate stops, walks over to Howard, kicking an empty wine bottle out of the way.  59.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Good point. Give me your keys.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: Fuck you. Howard takes another drink. Nate pulls the gun, points it at Howard’s head. Nate’s demeanor is darker and colder than we’ve seen it.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Give me the fuckin’ keys or you’re going to be lying out there next to your dead pigs. Michelle appears in the doorway of Howard’s room, surpris by Nate’s tone.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: (to Michelle) This is who you decided to throw your lot in with? After all I’ve done for you. Michelle marches over. Stands at Nate’s side.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: All you've done for me? You mean like running me off the road and nearly killing me. Howard’s face shifts through emotions -- lands on anger.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: (pointing at Nate) This asshole tell you that?

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: I saw your truck. It was you.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: You were unconscious, you don’t remember shit. I saved you.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: You have an answer for everything. But why are there always so many questions? Nate pulls back the hammer on the revolver.  60.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: I’m only going to say it once more. Give me the keys. His finger tenses on the trigger. He’s really going to sh Howard. Howard reaches into his pocket, pulls out his key ring, h it over. Nate smiles -- really enjoying this now.

dialogues.speaker: NATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The pump is fixed. When you sober up, take it down to the well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nate and Michelle stand at the door. Nate turns the key i the lock.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: This door requires a key on either side. Whenever we’re in here, this stays locked. If you get up to use the bathroom, you wake me first. If this door’s unlocked, I need to know about it. Michelle lets out a small laugh.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: First I’m locked in a cellar. Now I’m locked in a room in that cellar. Just keeps getting better. Nate turns on her, a cold look in his eyes --

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: You take this seriously or you could end up dead. Michelle is put off by his tone. She wipes away her smile nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The trap door to the crawl space is open. Howard pokes hi head out, looks at Nate, who is near the sink.  61.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: Should be working. Nate turns the faucet. Water POURS in a thick stream. Howard pulls himself up through the trap door and closes drags the throw rug back over it.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: You were down there so long, I thought you might have fallen in. Nate smiles cheerfully. Howard sneers.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: You’re one hell of a bastard, coming in here, taking over.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Shit. You didn’t give me any choice. But you were right about one thing. This place. It’s not big enough for three people.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: You’re going to kick me out?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Well, I’m not going anywhere. And neither is Michelle. Guess that only leaves you. She needs a little convincing, but she’ll come around. Nate looks over as Michelle enters from the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: NATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey, baby.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Morning... (a beat) If it is morning. God I hate having no idea what time it is. Nate opens the cupboard. Grabs a can of beans.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Being that all our meals are basically the same, guess it really doesn’t matter much. Michelle offers a weak smile.  62. Howard processes Nate’s words. His face is ashen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nate, Michelle and Howard sit around the table finishing their meal. Howard’s halfway through another bottle of wine. Nate pus his empty plate in front of Howard.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Clean that up, would ya. Nate gets up from the table, the revolver visible in his waistband.

dialogues.speaker: NATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This food is killing me. He pats his belly as he walks toward Howard’s room.

dialogues.speaker: NATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (with a smile) Just remember, I tried to get you to spend the extra money for a vent above the toilet.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: Least you could do is close the door. Nate swings Howard's bedroom door closed behind him. Howard leans in close to Michelle. He speaks in a hushed whisper.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You were right.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: About what?

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: This is all a put on. There was no attack. Nate and I planned this from the start. He talked me into it. Said we could get a girl down here and nobody would ever know. Michelle is caught completely off guard.  63.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Why are you telling me this?

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: Isn't it obvious? I’m jealous. You weren’t supposed to be only for him. Michelle’s stomach turns.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: You’re lying.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: About there being an attack or about there not being an attack? (a wry smile) You fell for it. Now you’re his little toy and I’m locked down here to suffer until he tires of you... And god only knows what’s gonna happen then. He can’t just let you walk out, can he?

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Why would I believe you?

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: Because you know it’s true. And you'll never be safe as long as he has that gun.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Giving you the gun isn’t gonna make me feel any better.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: Tell you what, just get me the keys. I’1l find a phone and call the police... What do you have to lose? Either you’re rid of me for good, or else I'll bring back help. Michelle looks doubtful.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I can get you out of here, back to your family, to your life. But only if you help me. The toilet FLUSHES. Howard peers at Michelle. She doesn’t say a word.  64. INT.
