HOWARD’S ROOM Howard sleeps on the mattress. Michelle comes in and nudges him awake. Howard’s eyes open. Michelle’s kneeling next to him. The ring JANGLES softly in her hand. Howard shakes off the cobwebs and grabs the keys from her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door to the small bedroom is closed. Michelle sits on couch, anxiously picking at her fingernails. Howard comes out dressed in a hazmat suit. They whisper -

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: If it’s all the lie, why are you wearing the suit?

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: Nate still has a gun. If he’s awake when I come back, we’ll tell him I had to check on the solar panels.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Are you coming back? Just then, the bedroom door whips open. Nate comes out, gun drawn.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Where the hell you think you're going?

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: The electricity’s shorting out. I need to check the panels. Nate sees the key ring in Howard’s hand. He turns to Michelle, eyes ablaze with rage.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: He said it was an emergency.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: And you didn’t wake me?  65.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: I was scared. I panicked. Nate flicks on the overhead light. It’s working fine.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: (to Howard) You’re free to go. But the suit stays here. Howard turns and heads back toward his bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: NATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The keys. Leave them on the table. Howard complies. Nate steps toward Michelle, a menacing look on his face.

dialogues.speaker: NATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I thought we were getting somewhere, you and me... He reaches up and gently rubs her chin with his hand that still holds the revolver. A shiver runs through Michelle the cold metal touches her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nate sleeps on the mattress. Michelle sits next to him, propped against her pillow, staring at the blank wall. She moves to get out of bed but stops. Shakes Nate. His h whips from under the pillow, gun pointed at Michelle. She flinches. Then gently pushes his gun arm away from he

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: I gotta use the bathroom. Nate sits up. He unties the key ring from his waistband, hands it to Michelle. INT. HOWARD’S ROOM Howard snores loudly on his mattress. Two empty wine bott rest on the cement floor next to his bed. Michelle tiptoes by him into the --  66.

dialogues.speaker: BATHROOM
dialogues.text: She pulls the curtain closed. Howard’s snoring stops. Michelle finishes peeing. She pulls up her underwear, par the shower curtains to leave -- Howard stands there, leering at her with drunken eyes.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: It’s all yours. She moves to slide by him. But he steps in front of her.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: You’re too good for me. But you’1ll lie down with that cretin.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Get out of the way.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: You’ve given me nothing but trouble since you got here. I should’ve left you in that ditch... Michelle steps around him into -- HOWARD’S BEDROOM Howard matches her steps, blocks her path to the door.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Get away from me!

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: ...-would’ve made my life so much easier. Howard steps toward her. Michelle reaches down, grabs a wine bottle and swings it. Howard jumps back, avoids the impact.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You bitch. He grabs Michelle around the neck, a crazed look in his e  67. And then -- WHAM! The revolver smashes Howard in the back of the head Howard collapses forward into Michelle, knocking both of onto the mattress, leaving Michelle underneath his limp b Nate stands over them both, looking down at Michelle.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: You ready to deal with this problem for good? Michelle looks up at Nate. He waits for a response. She stares at him a long beat... and shakes her head no. Nate turns and leaves the room as Michelle frantically struggles to get out from under Howard’s leaden weight. Michelle finally manages to push Howard off of her. She scurries for the door. INT. HOWARD’S ROOM - LATER Howard comes to -- reaches to the back of his head and fi it crusted with blood. He wobbles to his feet, stumbles into the --

dialogues.speaker: MAIN ROOM
dialogues.text: Michelle stands at the sink pouring out full wine bottles Judging by the dozen or so empty bottles on the counter, she’s been at it awhile.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: What are you doing? Michelle ignores him. Howard hurries over and grabs a bot out of Michelle’s hand.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Don’t touch me! Nate saunters into the room. He walks right up and holds revolver against Howard's skull.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: I’ve just about had enough of you.  68.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: That’s my wine.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Can't drink it if you’re dead. Howard lets go of the bottle and backs away. Nate locks eyes on Howard, a chilling look on his face --

dialogues.speaker: NATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You enjoy attacking women, don’t you?

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: I didn’t attack her. I would never do that. I... Howard reaches a hand out to Michelle -- she backs away f him.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Look, I got emotional. I’m sorry. But that’s not me.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: This whole set up has just about run its course... Michelle, go in the other room. Tears form in Michelle’s eyes.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: Wait, no. Michelle. Don't go! She turns away from Howard, walks into the bedroom and cl the door. Howard backs away from Nate. Nate grabs him by the scruff the neck with one hand, holds the gun to his temple with other.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: Nate, please don’t.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Get up the FUCKIN’ STAIRS! Nate shoves him forward. Howard stumbles, falls at the bo of the stairs. Tears form in his eyes.  69. Nate kicks Howard in the ass.

dialogues.speaker: NATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Move!

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: Please, please no.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: It’s not like I didn’t give you enough chances. Howard stumbles to his feet. Nate shoves the gun barrel i his back, pushes him into the --

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: (sobbing hysterically) Don’t, Nate. Please. What do I have to do? I’1l do anything! Nate pulls out the keys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michelle stands with her ear to the door, listening...

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You can’t do this! It’s murder... Tears form in her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: We can work this out. I'll stay out of your way. You won’t even know I’m here. Michelle reaches for the door handle... hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Please, Nate! Please...! Michelle pulls open the door. Rushes to the --

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: No! Stop!  70. Nate keeps his eyes on Howard, who’s kneeling on the stai

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don’t do it, Nate. Nate pauses, considering... Howard looks up to him with pleading eyes. Nate pushes Howard back down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Shut up. Howard stumbles into the --

dialogues.speaker: MAIN ROOM
dialogues.text: Nate follows on his heels.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: There are gonna be some changes. You stay in your room. Always. You wanna come out, you ask for my permission and you do it when she’s not out here. You don’t go anywhere near her, no matter what. Got me?

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: Okay. However you --

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: And stop talking. I’ve heard enough out of you for a lifetime. So do us all a favor. And shut the fuck up. Nate sneers at Howard. Howard returns an empty look -- something has snapped inside of both of them. INT. HOWARD’S ROOM - LATER Howard sits at the edge of his bed. He doesn’t move an in There’s a feral look in his eyes.  71.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michelle awakens -- next to Nate -- from a bad dream. Col sweat runs down her face. She shivers.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: (half asleep) You okay?

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Yeah. She burrows into his arms. He pushes her away, pulls off covers.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: I gotta piss. Nate climbs out of bed and crosses to the door. He unlock it, walks out, closing it behind him. Michelle hears the sound of Nate locking the door from th outside. She curls into her pillow, eyes flutter closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howard sits at the table, fiddling with the radio. Michelle walks in rubbing sleep from her eyes, she scans room, then walks into Howard’s room. A moment later she comes back in -- wide awake.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Where’s Nate? Howard looks up, mulls over his answer.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Where is he? There’s a long beat before Howard responds --

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: Said he heard something outside. Decided to go have a look.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: How long has he been gone?

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: A couple of hours.  72. She stares warily at Howard.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Think he’1l be back soon?

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: Depends on what he finds, I suppose. Michelle moves to the cupboard.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I knew this was gonna happen.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: What? Howard motions around the cellar.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: The attack. Way things have been going in the world -- growing population, dwindling resources. Too many rats in the cage. And a bunch of politicians who only care about getting a sound bite in the next news cycle -- it wasn’t hard to see we were coming to a crossroads. But that’s the problem with people -- they’re so damn entitled, so insistent on believing in whatever it is that they want to be true, facts be damned. Try telling them something they don’t want to hear. Might as well talk to the wall. Michelle nods, but doesn’t respond.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But sometimes people need to hear the truth.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Like what?

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: At the bottom of everything, people are selfish and brutal. We do what’s best for ourselves. We want to pretend like it’s logic or morality or religion. But it’s not. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s darker than that. And if you’re in denial... Howard locks eyes on Michelle --

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ..-if you’re in denial, Michelle, then you’re in danger. I know it’s hard to face facts, to admit it’s all a frenzy of selfish and desperate chaos. But if you don’t face those facts, you’re putting yourself in a far worse, far riskier position. Michelle breaks eye contact, pulls out some food her growing sense of unease.

-- masking Michelle washes her face at the sink. She reaches for a t and notices splattered drops of pink on it. She looks aro More drops of pink liquid remain in the bottom of the tub Could be watered down BLOOD. She stands there frozen, staring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howard is on the couch now, reading. He looks up as Miche enters.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: What really happened?

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Nate wouldn’t leave me down here with you. Not after what you did.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: I told you, it’1l never happen again. You made sure of that. Howard motions to the empty wine rack.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Guess I should thank you.  74.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: (stoic) Howard?

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: I can’t do it anymore.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: Can’t do what?

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Whatever you're going to do to me, just get it over with.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: You got it wrong. Nate was trying to... He’ll be back soon. You’1ll see. Silent tears begin to roll down Michelle's face.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: You told me the whole story was a lie. Then you begged for your life when Nate was going to make you leave. I can’t live with the uncertainty anymore. Or is that part of the game?

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I lied to you earlier. I needed the keys. I needed to get out. Nate was going to kill me.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: So what, you killed him first?

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: Michelle, I’m not going to do anything to you. I’d never hurt you. You’re like my own daughter.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: And you're like my father. He was a lying son of a bitch. Michelle’s lips quiver, she crumples against the wall.  75.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: Stop crying. I’m trying to help you. That’s all I’ve ever done... Michelle heaves. Howard aches for her, but knows better t to approach.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’s going to be alright. And then -- a RUMBLE echoes from outside. GRAVEL CRUNCHES under something heavy, something big. And it’s coming closer. Howard flips off the lights, leaving only a weak beam of sunlight from the tiny window at the top of the stairwell

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (whispering) Don’t make a noise. The vehicle stops above them. The engine cuts out -- An unnerving silence.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: (whispering) What if it’s help?

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: (whispering) What if it’s not? Howard moves toward Michelle who stands in near darkness looking up the stairwell... waiting.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: (barely audible) Maybe it’s Nate. Howard nods as he slowly, methodically moves closer. Michelle gazes at the stairwell, unsure of whether to scr for help or heave silently.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: (whispering) If it’s Nate, he’1ll knock. An eternity passes. The RUMBLE of the engine restarting breaks the silence.  76. Michelle suddenly charges for the stairwell --

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Help! Hel -- Howard tackles her, covers her mouth. The engine cuts out again. Michelle bites Howard, pulls free for a moment. But he pu her back and they struggle across the floor. And now there’s POUNDING on the stairwell door. LOUDER and LOUDER. Michelle squirms. Howard holds her down. He drags her tow a kitchen drawer and reaches into it. She bites him again but as she does so, he plunges a syringe into her arm. BANG, BANG, BANG from the stairwell. Michelle stops struggling.

dialogues.speaker: BANG, BANG, BANG
dialogues.text: Her eyes close. The pounding stops. As Michelle fades into unconsciousness, she hears -- The engine FIRING UP. The vehicle pulling away. Howard watches Michelle, a sad look on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michelle's car SQUEALS across the road... Her eyes wide in pure terror... And the car careens over the ledge, the back tires catchi and flipping it. It rolls to the bottom of the ditch -- a BROKEN GLASS and BENDING METAL. Then a sudden SILENCE as it comes to a rest. And the darkness is pierced by a set of headlights pullin a stop on the road above.  77. Someone climbs out of the vehicle and steps into the beam light. Then begins climbing down the side of the embankme

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's upside down, belted into her seat, the door crushed her side, blood gushing from her head, eyes slit open in consciousness. A sudden SHRIEK from the door but it refuses to be opened Another, louder SHRIEK. And again. And again. The door is Slowly pried open. And finally -- the door gives, swings open, revealing -- HOWARD, standing above Michelle, looking down at her. The expression on his face is... hard to read.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: Don't worry. Everything's going to be alright. As Howard reaches down for Michelle, she slips into unconsciousness...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michelle wakes up. Alone on the mattress where it all started. She gets to her feet, crosses the room and pulls on the d It’s locked. She leans in, examines the deadbolt lock abo the door handle. There are two flathead screws facing her. She touches the with her fingers... an idea forming. Michelle bangs on the door. She waits.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Come on! I gotta use the bathroom. Footsteps approach. The lock clicks. The door opens.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: Morning. Michelle walks by him without saying another word.  78.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howard sits at the table. He doesn’t notice as Michelle s a butter knife into her pocket. Michelle opens the cupboard, reaches to the very back and pulls out five bottles of wine. Howard sees them lined up on the counter.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: Where’d those come from?

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Nate had me hide some bottles. Said we should save them for special occasions.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: And what’s so special about today?

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: It's my birthday. Michelle starts opening the wine. Howard steps over, takes the bottle from her.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: Still, kind of early for that, wouldn’t you say? Howard looks down at the bottle in his hand, clearly temp

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: You got some big plans that I don’t know about? She puts her hand back on the bottle. Her fingers slightl overlap Howard’s fingers. He lets go of the bottle. Michelle finishes opening it. She pours herself some. Howard puts his hand over his empty glass.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: I’m good.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Gonna make me drink alone? Howard keeps his hand over the glass, fighting temptation  79.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come on. One drink. That’s it.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: Okay. One drink. And only because it’s your birthday. Howard moves his hand away. Michelle pours him a full gla

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The second bottle has been opened. Michelle and Howard si the table.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: I don’t really like this one.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: Open another. Michelle crosses, bringing her glass with her. She grabs another bottle off the counter and opens it. While Howard isn’t looking, she pours her full glass down drain. Michelle stumbles, nearly falls on her way back to the ta

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Careful. Maybe you’ve had too much.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Or maybe I haven’t had enough. She pours herself a full glass and tops off Howard.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: Normally, you don’t mix Chardonnay and Shiraz. But hell... He tastes a bit.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Makes a half decent rose. Michelle offers a smile, clinks glasses with Howard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michelle is on the couch, eyes barely open. There’s a fou bottle on the table in front of Howard.  80.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: (slurring) I miss beer. Wine’s too strong.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: Well if you didn’t guzzle it down so quickly...

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: And I miss Pepsi and Starbucks and lasagna and chocolate chip cookie dough...

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: We have some freeze dried lasagna. Somewhere...

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Uh huh. She’s fading. Her eyes close and she slumps on the couch.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: Alright, missy. I think it’s time for a nap. Howard stands, a bit wobbly himself. He walks over to Michelle and pulls her to her feet. She MOANS softly. Howard takes Michelle to her room, keeping her on a more less straight line. INT. MICHELLE’S ROOM Howard sets Michelle down on her bed. She rolls over and curls into a ball.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: There you go. Nothing a bit of sleep won’t sort out. He gently pulls a blanket over her as she sinks into the Howard stands up and watches her for a moment -- a soft, wistful look on his face -- Then he reaches into her purse which lies next to the bed digs around, pulls out her wallet. Michelle watches him anxiously through half-closed eyes.  81. Howard pulls out her driver’s license, stares at it a bea then tosses on the mattress next to her.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (ice cold) Hope you hid some more wine. Looks like we'll be doing this again in six months. For your real birthday. Michelle’s eyes pop wide open. Howard turns and walks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howard closes the door to Michelle’s room and locks it wi his key. INT. MICHELLE’S ROOM Michelle lies on the mattress, completely still, eyes wid open -- sober and aware. She slips out of bed -- in complete control of her senses Michelle pulls the butter knife from her back pocket and approaches the lock. The two flathead screws face Michelle. The butter knife i just thin enough to fit into the grooves. She goes to work loosening the screws.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howard sits at the table and pours himself another glass wine. He takes a big gulp and shakes his head disappointe INT. MICHELLE’S ROOM - LATER The screws have been removed from the deadbolt. Michelle her ear to the door, listening to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howard -- face down on the table -- SNORING. A fifth bott of wine is half empty in front of him.  82. The lock on Michelle’s door pops out of its hole. And the door swings open. Michelle hurries into the room and begins sifting through Howard’s pockets. She finds the keys and crosses to the metal door, unlocks Michelle pulls open the door and finds -- the HAZMAT SUIT along with the gun and a set of car keys. Michelle pockets the car keys, tucks the gun in her waist and grabs the suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michelle pulls on the hazmat suit. She checks herself in mirror and then exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michelle walks by a passed out Howard, heads up the stairwell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michelle reaches the top of the stairwell and goes throug the key ring. BUT THE KEY TO THE DOOR IS MISSING. She frantically goes through the keys again. Still not th She tries other keys, but none of them work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michelle returns to the bottom of the stairs and scans th room, looking for the key. Howard stirs, readjusts his head, but clearly he’s beginn to wake up. Michelle is growing frantic. She reaches down and slides carpet over, revealing the trap door. She pulls open the and climbs down into the --  83.

dialogues.speaker: CRAWL SPACE
dialogues.text: It’s only a couple of feet high. The well is at one dark Michelle glances around, finds what she’s looking for -- cracks of DAYLIGHT. She moves toward the light, doing her best not to scrape the suit. At the far end of the crawl space, she finds an old vent has been boarded over. She pulls at the boards, but they’re solid. So she rolls on her back, feet to the boards, and kicks as hard as she can. THUMP! But the boards hold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howard stirs, lifts his head at the sound of Michelle kic the boards in the crawl space. He shakes his head, still asleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michelle kicks the boards again. They’re starting to crac and come loose, revealing the old metal vent behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howard shakes himself out of his stupor. He sees the trap door wide open. Suddenly he’s fully awake. He moves to the trap door, ducks his head inside, spins around and finds -- The KICKED OUT VENT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A steady rain falls. Michelle comes around the side of th farm house in the hazmat suit, the mask is fogging from h breath. Rain patters off her hood.  84.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howard scrambles across the room, finds the closet door w open - gun and hazmat suit missing.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: Fuck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michelle comes around the corner of the farm house and freezes. Nothing she has experienced yet compares to the horror in her eyes now -- MICHELLE’S POV Mask FOGGED, but through it -- NATE, face down in a puddl raindrops bounce off the back of his head but it’s not en to wash away the blood, skull fragments and brain matter.

dialogues.speaker: WIDE
dialogues.text: Michelle lifts the hazmat mask from her face and stares i shock. INT. HOWARD’S ROOM Howard scrambles in, throws the mattress into the air and finds the cellar door key beneath it. He grabs the key and rushes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The LOCK CLICKS. The DOOR FLIES OPEN. Howard climbs out of the stairwell. He’s wrapped head to in a blanket. He scans the yard -- His eyes lock in on the two dead pigs -- steady raindrops chew at their rotting flesh. Howard hesitates for a long moment...  85.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michelle stands in the rain, staring at Nate’s body. She’ barely breathing.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Michelle! Michelle jumps at the sound of her name. ADRENALINE rushe through her veins.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: We gotta get back inside. It’s not safe! His voice is getting closer. Michelle scans her options -- THE WOODS -- fifty yards away. THE BARN -- twenty-five yards away. THE FARM HOUSE -- five yards away.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Michelle! His voice just around the corner now. Michelle rushes to the farm house’s back door, her feet churning up the muddy ground beneath her. She turns the handle. The door swings open. Howard comes around the corner, catches a glimpse of the hazmat suit disappearing inside the farm house. Howard glances down at Nate’s corpse for a brief moment t he makes for the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michelle spins the lock on the back door then peeks out t small window next to it -- Howard approaches, wrapped head to toe in the wet blanket Michelle reaches down to her waistband for the gun. Reali it’s on the inside of the hazmat suit. She grabs the suit’s zipper when --  86.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howard throws himself into the back door again and again. The door holds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zipper down, Michelle reaches into the hazmat suit. She pulls out the revolver. It slips in her gloved hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howard stops, takes a step back and kicks hard just below door handle.

dialogues.speaker: CRACK
dialogues.text: The door jamb splinters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michelle tries to thread her gloved and shaking finger through the trigger.

dialogues.speaker: BAM
dialogues.text: The back door FLIES OPEN. Howard stands in the doorway, his face all but hidden ben the wet blanket. Michelle spins -- the gun tumbles out of her slippery glo hits the ground near Howard’s feet. Michelle turns, bolts from the room.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: Wait! Howard pulls the wet blanket from his face. He reaches do and picks up the gun, shoves it in his pocket. Howard pushes the door closed behind him then follows Michelle’s muddy footprints out of the room.  87.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michelle rushes into the kitchen, over to the counter whe she starts tearing through the kitchen drawers.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (yells from the hallway) You’re not safe!

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: No shit! Michelle flings aside a silverware tray -- she’s done wit butter knives. She rips open another drawer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down the long corridor, Howard closes in -- watching Mich move frantically in the kitchen with her back to him.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: I didn’t have a choice. You didn’t know Nate like I did. He was dangerous... I did it for us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howard now visible in the hallway behind her. He moves slowly, talks calmly.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: He was going to kill me. I had to protect myself. Michelle still rooting through drawers, looking for something, anything she could use as a weapon.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: You coming to finish the job. Howard steps into the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: You don’t have to love me. You don’t even have to like me, but please. Don’t leave me. I don’t want to be alone. I’1l never hurt you. You can trust me.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Trust you? You’re a murderer.  88.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: It was self-defense.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: I don’t believe you. Michelle stops searching. She stands at the counter, froz but stays facing the other way. MICHELLE’S POV A refection in the rain-coated window -- Howard approaches her from behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howard’s close enough to touch her. He reaches out.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: I won’t let you leave. Michelle spins -- a butcher’s knife gripped in her hand.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: You can’t stop me! The blade slices throw the wet blanket that covers Howard he stumbles, falls to his ass, taking the knife with him. Michelle bolts toward the rear stairway. Howard looks down, a big slice through the wet blanket bu the blade only grazed his chest. Howard pulls the gun from his pocket as he gets to his fe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michelle races up the back stairs. A cumbersome task in t oversized hazmat suit. She glances over her shoulder. Howard starts up the stairs behind her, revolver at his s Michelle trips over the top step, stumbles, steadies hers on a large cabinet at the top of the landing. It wobbles against the wall.  89. Howard’s halfway up the stairs behind her. She tugs hard on the cabinet. It rocks more. She pulls on again. It rocks further. One more huge pull -- Tipping point -- The cabinet crashes down the stairwell, forcing Howard to retreat back down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michelle hurries into the master bedroom. A cordless phone sits on the bedside table. She rips it o of its cradle -- but the battery’s dead. Michelle throws the phone. Moves to the window -- a two s drop to the ground below. Her eyes lock on the yellow pickup parked against the bar She opens the window wide. Rain blows in, pattering off the carpeted floors as Miche leans out and looks down at the muddy ground below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howard marches up the main stairway, gun still in hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howard stalks into the bedroom. He sees the open window. He crosses the room, looks out the window -- no sign of Michelle. Howard turns back, looks around the room -- The closet door is closed. The bathroom door is half open. Howard slowly approaches the closet -- He rips open the door -- it’s empty. Howard walks toward the bathroom. He pushes the door all the way open.  90. He notices the shower curtain pulled across the tub. He steps into the --

dialogues.speaker: BATHROOM
dialogues.text: Howard reaches out, he grips the shower curtain -- He pulls it aside and finds -- MICHELLE, a bottle of foaming tile cleaner in her hand. S sprays the cleaner into Howard's face. He drops the revolver as his hands fly up to protect his eyes, but the damage is done. He’s momentarily blinded. Michelle lunges for the revolver.
